title: Instant Pot Pork Chops Recipe
description: These Instant Pot pork chops with butter, onion soup mix, and apple juice turn out tender and delicious for an easy dinner in just 30 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Pork Pork Chop Recipes Instant Pot Pork Chops 4.5 (57) 51 Reviews 5 Photos These pork chops are so easy to make in the Instant Pot. I needed a quick way to cook tender pork chops and this method did it. My husband and 6-year-old daughter fought over the leftovers! Submitted by LDMKitchen Updated on March 6, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 pork chops 3 tablespoons butter, cut into small chunks 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix (such as Lipton®) 1 cup apple juice Directions Gather all ingredients. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Holly Dreesman / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Place pork chops into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Holly Dreesman / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Dot butter over chops, then sprinkle with onion soup mix. Pour in apple juice. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Holly Dreesman / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for the pressure to build. Release the pressure using the natural-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Holly Dreesman / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco I Made It Print 86 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Pork Chops 01 of 05 Photo by  Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Holly Dreesman / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco 02 of 05 Photo by  Paula 12/10/2023 Next time I make this, I’ll brown the pork chops first. I made “Dry Onion Soup Mix” from this site since I didn’t have any and it turned out great. Like others, I too made a gravy from the juices in the pot. It was really good served on rice. 03 of 05 Photo by  Megan Seamons 03/03/2021 04 of 05 Photo by  Phil 01/04/2020 05 of 05 Photo by  lutzflcat 03/30/2019 3.30.19 I just knew this was going to be good, and I wasn't wrong. By all means, remove the chops from the pot after cooking is complete, and thicken the juices for an an awesome gravy/sauce. Apple juice and dry onion soup mix, what's not to like here, just knew it would be outstanding? I used boneless chops that were about 3/4" thick and threw in a few chunked gold yukon potatoes that cooked up beautifully. The only deviation from the recipe was that I seared the chops right at the beginning using the Sauté function for about 2 minutes per side just to get some color (for better eye appeal/presentation) and certainly would do that again. Very nice, tasty, and very easy dinner. 1 You’ll Also Love Instant Pot Smothered Pork Chops 4 Ratings Slow Cooker Ranch Pork Chops 6 Ratings Air Fryer Ranch Pork Chops 49 Ratings Mushroom Pork Chops 2,217 Ratings Honey Mustard Pork Chops 274 Ratings Pork Chops in Red Sauce 95 Ratings Instant Pot Pork Chops and Gravy 163 Ratings Parmesan Crusted Pork Chops 455 Ratings Instant Pot® Kalua Pig (Quick Hawaiian Pulled Pork) 3 Ratings Sweet and Tangy Apple Pork Chops 11 Ratings Lavender Pork Steaks 12 Ratings Instant Pot® Pulled Pork and Beans Teriyaki Pork Chops 39 Ratings Apple Pork Chops 515 Ratings Instant Pot® Pork Tenderloin 22 Ratings Perfect Simple Roasted Pork Chops 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
